description: From Latin aspalathus, from Ancient Greek ἀσπάλαθος (aspálathos).

entries.meaning: Any of the genus Aspalathus of flowering plants.
(obsolete) A thorny shrub yielding a fragrant oil.
examples: I gave a sweet smell like cinnamon and aspalathus, and I yielded a pleasant odour like the best myrrh, as galbanum, and onyx, and sweet storax  […]
